title: The ten impressive cities
name: The ten impressive cities
description:
A Map by Fnienhuis

I decide to submit my map with the ten favourite cities where I ever been. I saw a lot of cities, but these ten cities are the most impressive ones.

properties.name: Antwerp, Belgium
properties.description: Posted by FnienhuisAntwerp, does not look like a big city as a lot of Capital cities that I add as the most impressive cities. Still is Antwerp beautiful, it is a city in a village. Everything is close by each other. The port is one of the important businesses from Antwerp and when you walk there around is it massive.

properties.name: Barcelona, Spain
properties.description: Posted by FnienhuisLa Rambla, 19 Barcelona, my favorite city in the world. The ramblas as the main street, without cars, all the terraces with the nice environment. The shopping area is also amazing. Parc Guell and the Sagrade Familia, and the football stadion of Barcelona "Camp Nou". The city has the Spanish mentality, but also the mentality of the city, the combination of those two is in my perception the best combination for a city.

properties.name: Berlin, Germany
properties.description: Posted by FnienhuisLichtensteinallee, BerlinBerlin is a city with a lot of history. For example, from the history is in my opinion the Berlin wall. But Berlin has more then only the history. Every year is the biggest dance parade in Berlin, everybody is dancing on the street and everybody enjoyed there life.

properties.name: Chicago, United States of America
properties.description: Posted by Fnienhuis172 West Adams StreetChicago is a wonderfull city, with not only a beautiful skyline. The city is one of the three biggest cities in the United States. The people from Chicago are very friendly. The city is amazing with all the art.

properties.name: Lisbon, Portugal
properties.description: Posted by FnienhuisAvenida 5 de Outubro, 11 Lisbon, a city built on seven hills. When you drive to the city you need to cross the bridge, with the small Jesus Christus on the right side behind you. You see the city behind the water what gives a beautiful view. The terrace are wonderful and with the nice temperature is the city complete. Because of the small streets,and the hills make the city sociable.

properties.name: London, England
properties.description: Posted by Fnienhuis170 Westminster Bridge RdLondon is one of the biggest cities in Europe. With the dubble red busses are the streets with a lot of colors. Also London has a individuel mentality with a lot of international attractions.

properties.name: Luxor, Egypt
properties.description: Posted by FnienhuisEgyptLuxor, was back in the history the Capital of Egypt. Luxor is still famous about that, but also of the temples of Luxor. The city is primitive when you compare them with my list. When you drive into Luxor you can see how the people life near by the small rivers and how they still use a hourse with a woody hamper for the agriculture. The Nhile is a central point in Luxor. When you across the river with a boat you can feel the magic of the river. You can see how the people enjoy from the river.

properties.name: Rome, Italy
properties.description: Posted by FnienhuisViale regina margheritaRome has so many churches and tourism. For example, the Spanish stairs where every single moment of the day is there something going on. But also all the old buildings from the Roman time. But also the nice places where you can drink the best coffee in the world.

properties.name: Rotterdam, Netherlands
properties.description: Posted by FnienhuisRotterdam is the only city who was exploded by World War II. The Dutch infrastructure as the most cities like Amsterdam does not exist no longer in the city with the biggest port of Europe. The city looks kill, but I love the mentality of people from the city. Rotterdam is also special for me because of the Dutch soccerclub Feyenoord, with an amazing stadion, "De Kuip."

properties.name: Utrecht, Netherlands
properties.description: Posted by FnienhuisUtrecht is a small city in the Netherlands. In the middle of the centre is the Dom tower. When the area is clear you can see Amsterdam, but you have a beautifull view of the infrastructure of the Netherlands. The boundry of the downtown centre are the "grachten", it is difficult to explain how I descriobe a "gracht." In the URL is a picture of the "oude gracht" in Utrecht. The city is friendly, with the Neude and a the pubs around is that the middle point of the city where everybody and especially in the summer is.
